metadata.title: CVE-2020-27754 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In IntensityCompare() of /magick/quantize.c, there are calls toPixelPacketIntensity() which could return overflowed values to the callerwhen ImageMagick processes a crafted input file. To mitigate this, thepatch introduces and uses the ConstrainPixelIntensity() function, whichforces the pixel intensities to be within the proper bounds in the event ofan overflow. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to 6.9.10-69 and7.0.8-69.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27754` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11').
